snippet: Secretary of State John Kerry sought to offer support for negotiations aimed at ending that country’s guerrilla war and to ease concerns over the N.S.A.’s surveillance.
abstract: Sec of State John Kerry meets with leaders of Colombia, Washington’s top ally in South America, to offer support for negotiations aimed at ending that country’s guerrilla war and to ease its concerns over scope of National Security Agency's surveillance practices.

byline.contributor: Susan Abad contributed reporting from Bogotá, Colombia.

lead_paragraph: Secretary of State John Kerry sought to offer support for negotiations aimed at ending that country’s guerrilla war and to ease concerns over the N.S.A.’s surveillance.

headline.main: Kerry and Colombia Leaders Discuss Guerrilla War and Spying
headline.print_headline: Kerry and Colombia Leaders Discuss Guerrilla War and Spying
